Improve Your Driving Habits

Driving habits can have an enormous effect on fuel efficiency.These are some tips to improve your driving habits and reduce your car’s fuel consumption.

  • Use cruise control. Cruise control is an excellent way to keep your speed consistent and reduce fuel consumption. It takes out the human element of driving and prevents excessive speeding and acceleration.

  • Drive as smoothly as possible. Avoid sudden accelerations, abrupt braking and rapid gear changes, as all of these factors can reduce fuel efficiency.

  • Avoid unnecessary idling. Whenever possible, avoid idling your vehicle. It's an unnecessary waste of fuel and your car doesn’t require a long warm-up on cold days.

  • Observe the speed limit. You don’t have to drive slowly, but you should keep the speed overboard. For most cars, fuel efficiency starts to decline significantly when you go over 80 km/h.

Make sure your car is in good shape

The condition of your car is another determining factor for fuel consumption. Regularly check these items to ensure your vehicle stays in top shape.

  • Check your tires. Make sure your tires are properly inflated. Underinflated tires can increase your car’s fuel consumption by as much as 3.3 percent.

  • Check your air filter. Clogged air filters can also reduce a car’s fuel efficiency.

  • Get regular maintenance checkups. Make sure to have regular check-ups, oil changes and tune-ups. They all make a difference in the long run.

Other Tips

Here are a couple of additional tricks that can help reduce your fuel costs.

  • Utilize carpooling. Carpooling is an excellent way to reduce your fuel expenditure. If you get others in your car, you can split the fuel costs.

  • Look into alternative fuels. Talk to your mechanic about alternative fuels such as biodiesel or E85. They may not be available everywhere, but some cars can run on different fuels.

By following these tips you can significantly improve your car’s fuel economy. Regular maintenance and driving smoothly are just two of the many things you can do to reduce fuel costs and help save the environment. So put these tips into practice and enjoy the benefits.

frontmatter.description: This article discusses the global rise in the use of sustainable energy sources and the importance of countries working with each other in order to develop new renewable energy technologies. The authors describe the current state of renewable energy production and consumption, the growth in technology and the global investments made in order to create renewable energy sources, and negotiations between countries in order to create transportation infrastructure and policies around renewables. They emphasize the importance of working together in order to ensure a sustainable energy future, as well as long term economic and environmental benefits. The article concludes with a discussion of the challenges and opportunities in achieving renewable energy and the potential impact it can have on the global economy.
